conclusion: Analyze current positions and shapes of shadows to predict new positions and sizes.
Shadow A is cast by a small object and is located to the left of the object.
Shadow B is cast by the cake and is located to the left of the cake.
Shadow C is cast by the roll of toilet paper and is located to the left of the roll.
Shadow D is cast by the ring and is located to the left of the ring.
Light source moves to the back right, coming from behind and to the right of the objects.
Shadow A will move to the front left of the object and become longer.
Shadow B will move to the front left of the cake and become longer.
Shadow C will move to the front left of the roll of toilet paper and become longer.
Shadow D will move to the front left of the ring and become longer.
Shadows will generally become larger as the light source moves further away from directly overhead.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the front left of their respective objects and become larger.
